item.name: Login
item.description:
Called when the user clicks on *Login*. First, the server finds the User with the specified login information and finds the corresponding `id`, for the User (Java includes a class for generating UUIDs). The server returns the `id` as plain text.

The client holds on to the `id` and provides it in subsequent requests.

item.name: Sign Up
item.description: Called when the user clicks on **Sign Up**. The server creates a new User and stores the account information in the database. The account information is passed as a JSON object: `{"first_name": "John", "last_name": "Doe", "email": "jdoe1.@jhu.edu", "password": "password", "type": "patient", "medications": "[id1, id2, id3]"}`

item.name: Get User
item.description:
The server finds the User matching the `id`. The server returns the user information as a JSON object:

```
{
	"first_name": "John", 
	"last_name": "Doe", 
	"email": "jdoe1.@jhu.edu", 
	"password": "password", 
	"type": "patient",
	"points": "num_points",
	"streak": "num_streaks",
	"medications": "[id1, id2, id3]",
	"friends": "[id1, id2, id3]"
}
```

item.name: Update Account Information
item.description:
Modifies the account information of the User identified by `id` to match the provided information.

The new account information if provided in the HTTP Request Body as a JSON object:

```
{
	"first_name": "John", 
	"last_name": "Doe", 
	"email": "jdoe1.@jhu.edu", 
	"password": "password", 
	"type": "patient",
	"medications": "[id1, id2, id3]",
	"friends": "[id1, id2, id3]"
}
```
